div.a: The Underground Economy Where You Can Rent A Botnet For $2 Per Hour

div.div: The Russian underground economy has democratized cybercrime. You can buy a botnet for $700, or rent one for just $2 per hour.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SLk076&via=Digg&text=The Underground Economy Where You Can Rent A Botnet For $2 Per Hour

div.div: NO ONE WANTS TO VISIT ALPHA CENTAURI Bb

div.a: Why Are New Planet Names So Dull?

div.div: Scientists' could learn a thing or two from science fiction when it comes to naming newly discovered worlds.

div.div: New Yorkers not only wouldn't press charges, they'd pay the bill and tip her.

div.a: The British Have Invaded Nine Out Of Ten Countries

div.div: Britain has invaded all but 22 countries in the world in its long and colourful history.

div.div: THANK GOD THERE WAS NO TWITTER IN 2000

div.a: AP To Journalists: Be Careful What You Tweet On Election Night

div.div: The Associated Press has told staffers “not to blindly retweet what others may be saying” about election results on Tuesday night.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SFYSyd&via=Digg&text=AP To Journalists: Be Careful What You Tweet On Election Night

div.a: Hackers Replace NBC Sites With Smörgåsbord Of Hacker Cliches

div.div: Those in search of SNL and 30 Rock clips over at NBC’s videos page have been met with something quite different: a hacked page of weirdness with a surprisingly catchy soundtrack.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SqAwGf&via=Digg&text=Hackers Replace NBC Sites With Smörgåsbord Of Hacker Cliches

div.a: Chris Rock's Message To White Voters

div.div: Chris Rock explains to the American Caucasian majority that in desperate times like these, you need a white president.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R52CaY&via=Digg&text=Chris Rock's Message To White Voters

div.a: Everybody Lies, But Twitter Also Accelerates Truth

div.div: It might seem that lies on social networks have become as common as the truth. But is it a cause for worry?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U21ALb&via=Digg&text=Everybody Lies, But Twitter Also Accelerates Truth

div.div: ALMOST AS TERRIBLE AS REAL LIFE
"Social media experts" get the much deserved "Weekend Update" treatment.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VLkLdW&via=Digg&text=SNL Mocks The 'Social Media Expert'

div.div: ASTEROIDS: MORE THAN JUST LIFE ENDING ROCKS

div.a: Asteroid Belts Could Be Key To Finding Alien Life

div.div: If we want to find intelligent life elsewhere in the universe, it might be wise to look for stars with asteroid belts similar the one in our own Solar System.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VLBeP8&via=Digg&text=Asteroid Belts Could Be Key To Finding Alien Life

div.a: And You Thought Toothpick Art Was Tiny

div.div: After building a cable car out of toothpicks for a college art project, this artist decided to challenge himself even further by decreasing the scale of his projects.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WmFhaz&via=Digg&text=And You Thought Toothpick Art Was Tiny

div.a: 'Twitter Bombs' May Deliver Late Election Surprise

div.div: As US election day approaches, "Twitter bombs" are expected to fly as part of efforts to swing votes in a close race.tw

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9FcWi&via=Digg&text='Twitter Bombs' May Deliver Late Election Surprise

div.div: BRITISH GET EXTRA POINTS FOR REALISM

div.a: Who Destroyed The White House Best?

div.div: Independence Day may feature the most iconic destruction of the White House, but is it the best?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YEC2J0&via=Digg&text=Who Destroyed The White House Best?

div.div: DON'T BUY ANYTHING THAT CAN FLY

div.a: How To Stay Out Of Trouble During China's Transfer Of Power

div.div: To help those visiting China's capital on the eve of this once-in-a-decade change in leadership, Tea Leaf Nation has compiled a survival guide in this alternate universe known as "Spartan" Beijing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9NYni&via=Digg&text=How To Stay Out Of Trouble During China's Transfer Of Power

div.div: BEST SNL SKIT OF THE YEAR

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SHB8s1&via=Digg&text=Louis C.K. As Abraham Lincoln

div.a: The Human Centipede; Or, How To Move To New York

div.div: I moved to New York for graduate school. I was in my mid-twenties, and what do we do when we’re in our mid-twenties? We move to New York with very little money and very high hopes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U0AKJm&via=Digg&text=The Human Centipede; Or, How To Move To New York

div.div: The New York Times has helpfully laid out every possible election day scenario in one handy interactive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SIkloA&via=Digg&text=512 Paths To The White House

div.a: Why Do We Have Two Nostrils?

div.div: Having two ears and two eyes serves very real purposes–mainly echo location and depth perception. But is there a scientific reason for why we, and so many other animals, have two nostrils?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkHigw&via=Digg&text=Why Do We Have Two Nostrils?

div.div: WILLIE HORTON ALL DAY, EVERY DAY

Many predicted this would be the most negative presidential campaign in history, with outside groups blanketing swing-state airwaves with attack ads. But few thought the hostility would erupt quite so intensely from the candidates themselves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9vDXA&via=Digg&text=R.I.P. Positive Ads In 2012 Election

div.a: Apple Paid Only 2% Tax Outside U.S.

div.div: Apple paid less that 2% corporation tax on its profits outside the US, its filing with US regulators has shown.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R4UzLn&via=Digg&text=Apple Paid Only 2% Tax Outside U.S.

div.a: New Jersey Allowing Citizens To Vote Over Email

div.div: Voters in New Jersey now have two more ways to send in their ballots in an already unusual election season complicated by superstorm Sandy: via fax and email.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/POhNIO&via=Digg&text=New Jersey Allowing Citizens To Vote Over Email

div.a: A Record Player That Turns Your Drawings Into Music

div.div: Like the record player that plays slices of wood and the globe that plays sounds from around the world as it spins, the creators of the Dyskograf have found a new way to create music.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SzwewX&via=Digg&text=A Record Player That Turns Your Drawings Into Music

div.a: What Your Booze Says About Your Politics

div.div: Romney's not a drinker, but most beers lean right, while liberals prefer Absolut.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TrN92u&via=Digg&text=What Your Booze Says About Your Politics

div.a: Apple Hides Samsung Apology So It Can't Be Seen Without Scrolling

div.div: Apple modified its website recently to ensure the message is never displayed without visitors having to scroll down to the bottom first.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ToqhTO&via=Digg&text=Apple Hides Samsung Apology So It Can't Be Seen Without Scrolling
